page.title: 08Shopping in South Clifton
page.content: There is one small village shop in South Clifton and one in Marnham.These are used mostly for odd items needed in emergency or children requiring sweets.A mobile shop from the nearby village of Newton on Trent comes round once a week as does a Butcher's van.Most families do their main shopping in either Lincoln,Newark or Gainsborough which are all roughly 12 miles away.There are large superstores at these centres providing cheaper goods along with the Asda superstore at North Hykeham.The family visits these centres once a week on a Friday evening or a Saturday.Others visit the large open air Market at Newark on a Wednesday or Saturday.There is one bus a week on a Wednesday to and from Newark for people without transport,otherwise they must rely on the goodwill of neighbours for a lift.
